<item><title>Ariya targets Rio gold after LPGA Tour breakthrough</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/ariya-targets-rio-gold-lpga-tour-breakthrough-072904925--golf.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/O8qvSwWv8tewOCWOb3XMxg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T072904Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C0B5_RTROPTP_2_GOLF.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="LPGA: ANA Inspiration - Final Round" align="left" title="LPGA: ANA Inspiration - Final Round" border="0" /></a>By John O&#039;Brien SINGAPORE (Reuters) - Ariya Jutanugarn sank a gutsy par putt on the 72nd hole to become the first Thai to claim an LPGA Tour victory last weekend and after finally getting her maiden win after several near misses, the 20-year-old has set her sights firmly on Rio. Big-hitting and renowned for her aggressive play, Ariya famously blew a two-shot lead on the final hole of her home Honda LPGA Thailand event in 2013 when a stunning triple-bogey eight handed Korea&#039;s Park In-bee a one-shot triumph. At last month&#039;s ANA Inspiration, Ariya held a two-shot lead late in the final round of the season&#039;s first major but three bogeys in a row from the 16th handed the title to world number one Lydia Ko as the Thai was left to rue another collapse.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/ariya-targets-rio-gold-lpga-tour-breakthrough-072904925--golf.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 12:59:04 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">ariya-targets-rio-gold-lpga-tour-breakthrough-072904925--golf</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/O8qvSwWv8tewOCWOb3XMxg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T072904Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C0B5_RTROPTP_2_GOLF.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/ariya-targets-rio-gold-lpga-tour-breakthrough-072904925--golf.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/O8qvSwWv8tewOCWOb3XMxg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T072904Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C0B5_RTROPTP_2_GOLF.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="LPGA: ANA Inspiration - Final Round" align="left" title="LPGA: ANA Inspiration - Final Round" border="0" /></a>By John O&#039;Brien SINGAPORE (Reuters) - Ariya Jutanugarn sank a gutsy par putt on the 72nd hole to become the first Thai to claim an LPGA Tour victory last weekend and after finally getting her maiden win after several near misses, the 20-year-old has set her sights firmly on Rio. Big-hitting and renowned for her aggressive play, Ariya famously blew a two-shot lead on the final hole of her home Honda LPGA Thailand event in 2013 when a stunning triple-bogey eight handed Korea&#039;s Park In-bee a one-shot triumph. At last month&#039;s ANA Inspiration, Ariya held a two-shot lead late in the final round of the season&#039;s first major but three bogeys in a row from the 16th handed the title to world number one Lydia Ko as the Thai was left to rue another collapse.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>No deadline for JLR-Silverstone talks</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/no-deadline-jlr-silverstone-talks-072312466--f1.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/_ddxhpOE6ONt5aAZoyGo.g--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T072312Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C0AY_RTROPTP_2_FORD-ALCHEMY.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="A Jaguar statue is seen outside a Jaguar dealership in Leeds northern England" align="left" title="A Jaguar statue is seen outside a Jaguar dealership in Leeds northern England" border="0" /></a>By Alan Baldwin BARCELONA (Reuters) - Negotiations for Jaguar Land Rover to take over Silverstone are ongoing but neither side are under any time pressure to do a deal, said the British Grand Prix track&#039;s managing director Patrick Allen. Members of the British Racing Drivers&#039; Club (BRDC), which owns the Formula One circuit and surrounding land, last month gave their board a mandate to negotiate with the carmaker. Jaguar Land Rover hopes to boost its brand by building a hotel and visitor centre at Silverstone, allowing tourists and families to visit and drive vehicles on the track, a source told Reuters.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/no-deadline-jlr-silverstone-talks-072312466--f1.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 12:53:12 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">no-deadline-jlr-silverstone-talks-072312466--f1</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/_ddxhpOE6ONt5aAZoyGo.g--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T072312Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C0AY_RTROPTP_2_FORD-ALCHEMY.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/no-deadline-jlr-silverstone-talks-072312466--f1.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/_ddxhpOE6ONt5aAZoyGo.g--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T072312Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C0AY_RTROPTP_2_FORD-ALCHEMY.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="A Jaguar statue is seen outside a Jaguar dealership in Leeds northern England" align="left" title="A Jaguar statue is seen outside a Jaguar dealership in Leeds northern England" border="0" /></a>By Alan Baldwin BARCELONA (Reuters) - Negotiations for Jaguar Land Rover to take over Silverstone are ongoing but neither side are under any time pressure to do a deal, said the British Grand Prix track&#039;s managing director Patrick Allen. Members of the British Racing Drivers&#039; Club (BRDC), which owns the Formula One circuit and surrounding land, last month gave their board a mandate to negotiate with the carmaker. Jaguar Land Rover hopes to boost its brand by building a hotel and visitor centre at Silverstone, allowing tourists and families to visit and drive vehicles on the track, a source told Reuters.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Doping program behind Russian medals at Sochi Olympics - report</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/doping-program-behind-russian-medals-sochi-olympics-report-024911089--spt.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/XVPpPJJsAt8mpn8VtitnhA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T071902Z_3_LYNXNPEC4B1I1_RTROPTP_2_RUSSIA.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Employee arranges medals for the 2014 Winter Olympic Games during a presentation for the public at a jewellery shop in St. Petersburg" align="left" title="Employee arranges medals for the 2014 Winter Olympic Games during a presentation for the public at a jewellery shop in St. Petersburg" border="0" /></a>By Reuters Staff Dozens of Russian athletes who competed at the 2014 Sochi Winter Olympics, including at least 15 medal winners, were part of a state-run doping program, the New York Times reported on Thursday. The report is broadly consistent with revelations by an independent World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) commission last November of widespread state-sponsored doping in Russia, which led to a ban on the country competing in international athletics competitions. According to the New York Times report, which is based largely on evidence from Grigory Rodchenkov, the director of the country&#039;s anti-doping laboratory during the Sochi Olympics, those involved included some of Russia’s biggest stars of the Games, including 14 members of its cross-country ski team and two veteran bobsledders who won two golds.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/doping-program-behind-russian-medals-sochi-olympics-report-024911089--spt.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 12:49:02 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">doping-program-behind-russian-medals-sochi-olympics-report-024911089--spt</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/XVPpPJJsAt8mpn8VtitnhA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T071902Z_3_LYNXNPEC4B1I1_RTROPTP_2_RUSSIA.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/doping-program-behind-russian-medals-sochi-olympics-report-024911089--spt.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/XVPpPJJsAt8mpn8VtitnhA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T071902Z_3_LYNXNPEC4B1I1_RTROPTP_2_RUSSIA.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Employee arranges medals for the 2014 Winter Olympic Games during a presentation for the public at a jewellery shop in St. Petersburg" align="left" title="Employee arranges medals for the 2014 Winter Olympic Games during a presentation for the public at a jewellery shop in St. Petersburg" border="0" /></a>By Reuters Staff Dozens of Russian athletes who competed at the 2014 Sochi Winter Olympics, including at least 15 medal winners, were part of a state-run doping program, the New York Times reported on Thursday. The report is broadly consistent with revelations by an independent World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) commission last November of widespread state-sponsored doping in Russia, which led to a ban on the country competing in international athletics competitions. According to the New York Times report, which is based largely on evidence from Grigory Rodchenkov, the director of the country&#039;s anti-doping laboratory during the Sochi Olympics, those involved included some of Russia’s biggest stars of the Games, including 14 members of its cross-country ski team and two veteran bobsledders who won two golds.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Doping bombshells rock WADA meeting as drug crisis deepens</title><description>By Steve Keating MONTREAL (Reuters) - World sport is facing an unprecedented drug crisis as yet another in a string of doping bombshells dropped at the World Anti-Doping Agency's (WADA) foundation board meeting on Thursday, shocking officials. WADA, the International Olympic Committee (IOC) and athletes were all left stunned by an explosive New York Times report that detailed widespread doping by Russia at the 2014 Sochi Winter Olympics, including 15 medal winners. It was all part of a dark day for anti-doping crusaders as Russia was once again in the spotlight along with Kenya, after the African nation famous for its middle and long-distance runners was declared non-compliant and now faces a possible Olympic ban.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/doping-bombshells-rock-wada-meeting-drug-crisis-deepens-071902609--spt.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 12:49:02 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">doping-bombshells-rock-wada-meeting-drug-crisis-deepens-071902609--spt</guid></item><item><title>Russian sportsmen named in doping scandal call claims nonsense - TV</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/russian-sportsmen-named-doping-scandal-call-claims-nonsense-071724386--spt.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/epSNM.tcPwSIRkWfSP5SyA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T071724Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C0AL_RTROPTP_2_NORDIC-SKIING.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Legkov of Russia competes in the men&#039;s 15 km free individual race at the Nordic World Ski Championships in Falun" align="left" title="Legkov of Russia competes in the men&#039;s 15 km free individual race at the Nordic World Ski Championships in Falun" border="0" /></a>MOSCOW (Reuters) - Russian skier Alexander Legkov and bobsledder Alexander Zubkov, named in doping allegations by the former head of Russia&#039;s drug testing laboratory, have rejected the claims as &quot;nonsense and slanderous&quot;, Russia&#039;s Match TV reported on Friday. The denials follow a report in the New York Times which cited Grigory Rodchenkov, the former laboratory head, as saying that dozens of Russian athletes who competed at the 2014 Sochi Winter Olympics, including at least 15 medal winners, were part of a state-run doping program. ...</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/russian-sportsmen-named-doping-scandal-call-claims-nonsense-071724386--spt.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 12:47:24 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">russian-sportsmen-named-doping-scandal-call-claims-nonsense-071724386--spt</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/epSNM.tcPwSIRkWfSP5SyA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T071724Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C0AL_RTROPTP_2_NORDIC-SKIING.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/russian-sportsmen-named-doping-scandal-call-claims-nonsense-071724386--spt.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/epSNM.tcPwSIRkWfSP5SyA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T071724Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C0AL_RTROPTP_2_NORDIC-SKIING.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Legkov of Russia competes in the men&#039;s 15 km free individual race at the Nordic World Ski Championships in Falun" align="left" title="Legkov of Russia competes in the men&#039;s 15 km free individual race at the Nordic World Ski Championships in Falun" border="0" /></a>MOSCOW (Reuters) - Russian skier Alexander Legkov and bobsledder Alexander Zubkov, named in doping allegations by the former head of Russia&#039;s drug testing laboratory, have rejected the claims as &quot;nonsense and slanderous&quot;, Russia&#039;s Match TV reported on Friday. The denials follow a report in the New York Times which cited Grigory Rodchenkov, the former laboratory head, as saying that dozens of Russian athletes who competed at the 2014 Sochi Winter Olympics, Tomic and Nick Kyrgios were warned by Australia&#039;s Olympic chef de mission Kitty Chiller at the weekend that they were among a group of athletes whose behaviour was being monitored to judge their suitability for the Rio team. &quot;With a heavy sense of regret, I have made the difficult decision to not play with the Australian tennis team as they pursue an Olympic medal in Rio,&quot; Tomic said in a statement.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/tomic-too-busy-represent-australia-rio-053932007--ten.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 11:09:32 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">tomic-too-busy-represent-australia-rio-053932007--ten</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/yf6Aon0Nwtr75ZrEBpyqDg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T235713Z_1_LYNXNPEC4B1U0_RTROPTP_2_TENNIS-OPEN.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/tomic-too-busy-represent-australia-rio-053932007--ten.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/yf6Aon0Nwtr75ZrEBpyqDg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T235713Z_1_LYNXNPEC4B1U0_RTROPTP_2_TENNIS-OPEN.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Australia&#039;s Tomic hits a shot during his third round match against compatriot Millman at the Australian Open tennis tournament at Melbourne Park" align="left" title="Australia&#039;s Tomic hits a shot during his third round match against compatriot Millman at the Australian Open tennis tournament at Melbourne Park" border="0" /></a>Australia&#039;s Bernard Tomic ruled himself out of consideration for the Rio Olympics on Friday due to an &quot;extremely busy&quot; playing schedule, with the world number 22 saying he would play an ATP tournament in Mexico instead. clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Russian team Rostov subjected to random doping test - FIFA</title><description>Russian Premier League side Rostov had their entire team subjected to a random doping test following their match against Dinamo Moscow on Thursday, FIFA said. FIFA, confirming a report by Russia's Tass news agency, said the test was routine and there were no complaints from players or officials. Rostov, second in the league and two points behind CSKA Moscow, won the match 3-1.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/russian-team-rostov-subjected-random-doping-test-fifa-010114328--sow.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 08:19:11 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">russian-team-rostov-subjected-random-doping-test-fifa-010114328--sow</guid></item><item><title>WADA may ask IOC to retest Russian Sochi doping samples</title><description>WADA's incoming director general said on Thursday he'd consider asking the International Olympic Committee to retest samples of Russian athletes from the Sochi Games, following allegations of systemic doping in that country. Olivier Niggli said the World Anti-Doping Agency would investigate allegations made by the former director of Russia's anti-doping lab in the New York Times, and could ask the IOC to retest samples if it deems the information useful. While the cost of retesting could limit WADA's ability to probe frozen athletes' samples from the 2014 Sochi Olympics, athletes have called for action in the wake of the Russian allegations.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/wada-may-ask-ioc-retest-russian-sochi-doping-024911072--spt.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 08:19:11 +0530</pubDate><source
